title: Cleaning while also parenting/working/surviving - advice needed!
self_text: So, I guess I'm not a "new" mum - LO is now 1 year old, I'm back at work part time, things feel normal and good and I'm happy with everything... except the state of the house.  I would really like to live in a cleaner, tidier house. I'm all for lowering my standards, but the standards are on the floor, along with the toys, the rubbish, the laundry. My partner does his fair share but works full time, often doing 8 day shift stretches, and when it comes to the weekend we want to enjoy it properly with our baby. We can't afford a cleaner (not even a once-a-month or one off clean, we tried that), but equally, saving any cleaning for when we have chance to do it properly means it takes up basically the whole day - it's boring, messy and the one whose doing it (and not taking the baby) resents the whole thing.  So my question is - what are the things we could be doing during the week (beyond the usual basic chores you can do quietly in the evenings when baby is in bed) that will cut down the 'big clean' time? Hacks, tiktok accounts, konmari - as parents, what  actually  works and helps make life easier and stops you living in slum conditions? Have you found anything that's been  revelation?  (Please don't say 'see past the mess' or anything like that - I genuinely do have low standards, but there comes a point where things do need to be cleaner and tidier than they are, because hygiene/safety + small baby)

title: DAE get told they talk too much?
self_text: I work at a small jewelry store. Recently, a few of my co workers asked me why I was being so quiet and that they were worried because usually I talk so much they want to tell me to shut up. So, naturally, I’m even more quiet. Who likes to be told that?? Literally no one.   Then one day, I have a bad day and I was talking a lot. I don’t like silence. I like to talk. I like getting to know things in general. At the end of the night, my store manager was laughing and said just to let you know, you talked too much tonight.   I know that they’re jokes, but they don’t feel like jokes. I also know that I’m not going to actually tell them how I feel because that’s going to be awkward. I always get pushed aside when it comes to my feelings as well.   I’ve always been told that I talk a lot or that I talk too much. That I’m annoying and etc. I didn’t realize how much it would follow me after school. It’s made my past couple weeks pretty bad.   I was talking with a customer one day and my manager was with me. We were trying to make a sale and the man was unsure. He said he was going to walk around and that he’d be back. My manager had turned to me and said that when she’s talking to not say anything because I made us lose a sale. I don’t understand how it was my fault?

title: I'm extremely jealous of influencers.
self_text: I know they're just people like me, but my life at the moment is just not great. I find myself watching vloggers and influencers on Instagram with this large following and I just think to myself, "Man, I wish I could be them." Have money. Be unconcerned with my financial situation. Have strangers that care about me. Be heard.   I feel like I have nothing going on with my life. I work two jobs and go to school full time. I don't have time for anything, not friends, not family, most of the time. I'm constantly busy with my degree. It'll probably be better once I've graduated, but. . .right now I'm struggling for money, struggling to eat, can barely make rent, all the while watching these people live their best lives and be in seemingly happy relationships and travel and buy stuff.   I thought about starting my own YouTube channel. Not just for the money or to be recognized, but because I think I could have a decent following if I put my mind to it. I've always had a comedic side and ever since I got social media I found myself making original content, and I really think about buying equipment and getting started on doing it seriously. But then I think to myself, "Who the hell would care about my content? Who would watch me?" And I get sad all over again.   Does anyone else experience this feeling? This feeling of, "Man I'm such a regular ass person, I've got nothing going on"? I want to do stuff. Be remembered for something, at least. Idk. I'm broke and sad and just wishing shit was different.

title: My wife wants the passwords to my devices
self_text: Hi all, I know this will be an issue that can be quite divisive and my position is that couples/individuals should do what feels right for them.  Me (35M) and my wife (31F) have been married for a year and a half, and have been together for just over 5 years. Since fairly early in the relationship she has asked for the passwords for my devices. I am someone who appreciates a little privacy in a relationship and have been very clear to say I am not okay with this.  I do give her access to all my devices when she asks. It's very common for her to ask for my phone if we've been out or on holiday so she can transfer photos to herself, so I unlock my phone, give it to her and go do my thing (eg. go to sleep, leave the room). I only mention the latter to say that I don't 'supervise' her using my devices. All my personal stuff (Gmail, Facebook, SMS, Whatsapp) would be accessible but I trust her not to open these things. She rarely needs to use my computer for anything but I do the same when she does ask. The only reason I would say no to her using either is if I am actively using them at the time. Suffice to say, I have no issue with her using my devices but I would like her to ask first.  She raised the point that she might need emergency access to my devices if I was incapacitated, which I think is reasonable. I have been setting up a password manager for myself, and it has a feature that would allow her access to everything (incl financial accounts, etc.) if needed. I don't restrict her access to financial accounts but she has no interest in our share investments so she doesn't have much to do with them.  My wife is very firm that she sees this as a lack of trust on my part.  TL;DR: Wife wants passwords for my phone and computer. I give her 'unsupervised' access to both whenever she asks but I would want her to ask me first.  Edit - given the nature of some of the replies: I should say that I don't think either of us is concerned about infidelity. It's mostly a situation where she wants unfettered access and me wanting to be asked for permission.

title: AITA for asking my boyfriend to work at the office 2 days a week?
self_text: My boyfriend (m35) and I (F34) live together with our son (m2). We both work 4 days a week and have 1 day with our son. My boyfriend has lost both his parents a couple of years ago and an unborn child with his previous partner. He’s had a hard time since then.   Since we’ve moved in together (3 years ago) my boyfriend has had issues with going to the office. We are both people that need space to function, for us that means being alone in the house. I have ADD so I really need my alone time. We agreed we would ‘give’ each other one day a week without the other one home. We also agreed we would be at the office when the other was home with our son.   My boyfriend always seemed to have a problem that could only be solved by working from home.  He’s had 3 jobs and all 3 jobs have made it ‘impossible’ for him to work at the office. He was reluctant to go because of covid, it was difficult because he had to ask permission to go to the office and now the reason is because he hates his job.   I’ve also asked him to please leave me alone while working, because I’m easily distracted and need a long time to regain my concentration. He agrees to -and it works for a week- after a week he starts to bother me again. When confronted he always says he is just happy and in the heat of the moment and forgets our agreement.   Al these years I have tried to ask him to work at the office, I’ve begged, pleaded, tried to talk though his difficulties, but to no avail.  I feel like I have no time alone, because I’m either with the baby or working, and when I’m working from home, he is also home. And he doesn’t leave me alone while I’m working. I’m losing my mind.  I quit my job 1 year ago because I was tired of not sleeping and I wanted to change jobs. Also because we had a lot of fights over the above and I thought that maybe quitting my job and finding some rest at home would help. It was a tough year for me. Also my dad died this summer. My boyfriend did what he could to support me. It included doing 50/50 housework, even though I was home, so I could have done 100%. I’m really grateful for this of course.   I’ve recently started a new job and I need to study for exams. So I really need my time alone.   So an hour ago I asked him to please work from the office for two days a week. He agreed and said he would try to work towards it, but that it would take time because it was difficult for him.  I also told me I had to work on trying to learn to concentrate while he is home. He feels as if he is being kicked out of the house.   I lost it and told him to please start working on his issues because it’s not normal to never go to the office.   So, aita? I feel like I’m the asshole here because I was home for an entire year and he helped me through it and he is obviously having larger issues here so I should be greatfull for the year he supported me and just suck it up and help him through his issues.  EDIT I’ve been informed I need to add this for clarity: I work from the office 3 days and work 1 day at home, as per our agreement, my bf doesn’t want to do 2 days at work and 2 at home. Also my boyfriend didn’t financially support me during my year off.

title: What should I do? I'm feeling extremely insecure and jealous. 6 years relationship, 2 in distance
self_text: See TD;LR in the last paragraph  First of all, english is not my first language so sorry in advance for any grammar or spelling mistakes. I currently find myself in the US but I was born abroad. Me (22F) and my boyfriend (22) have been together for the last 6 years. We started when we were very young and stupid, so we've lived a bunch of ups and downs and have learned from them. The biggest one was 4-5 years ago (we were 17) when I found out that he cheated on me. An aqcuaintance of mine sent me pictures of a couple of chats he had with two different girls asking them to hook up basically. I was never able to confirm what they did. One of the girls rejected him in the ss but I never confirmed anything about the other one. He admitted that the chats were real tho. Because I was young and naive, I forgave him even tho my heart and emotional stability were completely broken. After that, he changed for the better, but I was never able to completely heal from what happened.   In 2020, I was able to get a full athletic scholarship in North Carolina. This is important because flying to my country (where my boyfriend currently lives) takes 13 hours. Of course, I wasn't going to miss this opportunity and my bf fully supported my decision. It was really hard leaving him and my family behind but it was the best decision I could've made.   The first year was fine, we had ok communication and I was too busy in school and practice to pay much attention to details in our relationship. I was genuinely happy with my life. Then, he found a job in a different city from our hometown and I supported him as much as I could. But the problems started there. He doesn't like calls, so our first year we literally called each other at most twice. He would only talk to me through games voicechats (lol, valorant). I talked to him about how important it was for me to make calls but he never did it anyway. We can only see eachother twice a year for at most a week.  When he moved, he started hanging out with his friends more often. Many of these people are friends of mine or acquaintances, so it never felt off. It started to bother me when his female friends started staying at his house after parties and stuff. They are people I know, so he kind of expected me to be okay with it, but I still felt uneasy ~When I forgave him, I decided to trust him again, so I understand that I commited to not being jealous over things that aren't justified~. He once asked me if I was okay with him moving in with a girl (A) to reduce expenses and I immeadetely refuse. I feel like nothing good would come out of it. I asked him and myself multiple time why did it have to be a girl; he has boyfriends. I've been rooming only with girls because I respect my relationship and I wouldn't like him to feel uncomfortable.   At the end, he said that he wouldn't do it if that was going to affect our relationship, but he didn't think it should be that big of a deal because A loves and we used to be really close. Then, he started planning short trips to nearby towns with A. I was a bit annoyed because when I went to visit him he would play videogames most of the day with the excuse that I could also play. I asked him to do something like those trips but it never happened. Because of that, I decided to organize a trip to the beach. I bought the tickets and reserved everything, but he didn't help me at all. He payed his part, but he was not involved in the planning process. But whenever there is a girlfriend coming to his house, he prepares everything and find activities to keep them entertained. This made me feel jealous and down.   Right now a different girl from our past (lets call her L, she used to like him when we were not in a relationship and me and  her used to be good friends back then) is staying at his house. She traveled from our hometown to my bf's city just to spend time with him. She just broke up with his bf and her mom died years ago, so my bf said that it was a good reason for her to travel to him for comfort. I try to understand his and her position but I still feel betrayed. If he takes more than an hour to answer I can only imagine that he's cheating on me with her. I don't get how he finds so normal having a girl staying at his extremely small apartment for days and declining my phone calls when I'm trying to buy tickets to visit him. Also, he's been telling me all the activities and places they've visited, and that's the reason he doesn't pay attention to his phone. Activities include watching series and playing sports together.   Everything seems worse to me knowing that I've been insisting him for months, more than a year by now, to get his VISA's appointment and to send me his resume in english so that we can be here together. He says that he wants to come, that he wants to live with, me but he hasn't done anything!  ~We've already talked about marriage and organizing a life together in the past. He's usually the one talking about it and insisting in making life projects together.~  I will travel this week home but it might be the last time in the next 5 years. I remind him too often to do these things, but he shows concern for the next 5 minutes and then just forgets about it for another month. I don't know if all of this is worth it. He's so calm about it that it makes me feel like I'm the one overreacting. I just want to know how far from being objective I am. I just want to escape but I can't forget all the beautiful things he's done for me everytime I try. I know I only said the bad stuff but he has supported me in my worst moments. Knowing that we'll be together in two weeks, what should I tell him? Feel free to ask for more context, even tho this is already long lol.  TL;DR: Me (22F), BF (22M), 6 years together, 2 distance  We live in different countries. He doesn't live in my hometown anymore, so it's even harder to see each other. He doesn't like phone calls, so he declines my calls 90% of the time, so communication is lacking. He cheated on me 4-5 years ago but I forgave him (I know I shouldn't),  but then became the most loving boyfriend on earth.   He's always cared a lot for his females friends to the point it makes me feel uncomfortable. Now one of those friends is staying at his house and I feel extremely uneasy. He finds it just natural to help his friend to feel better and talks to me the same way as usual. However, he spends too much time and energy in her. It takes him up to 2-3 hours to answer. I haven't explicitly told him that I'm bothered even tho it's pretty obvious.  He's not doing anything to come to the US with me (legally of course) even tho he insists it is his dream. I'll see him in two weeks that I'm finally traveling for christmas and I'm wondering what should I tell him or what should I do now. I might not travel home again for the next 5 years (because of OPT) Knowing that we'll be together in two weeks, what should I tell him?

title: I think my taken boss (31M) is flirting with me (21F)
self_text: I am posting this for a friend with her permission: My friend met a guy at a party about 5 months ago, he was cute so she approached him to flirt. It turned out he was in a long term relationship so she laid off of the flirting.. Fast forward she is now working for him and they are very close buddies. They go out to bars about 1-2 times a week after work, and they text often (usually just memes, music or he has also replied to her stories on instagram). He mentioned to her that his partner was jealous when they talked at the party..  He has made comments on her appearance such as "You're so adorable" or "you're cute"... The last time they went out to a bar, they had a very deep personal conversation about family and other things.. He even held her hands to feel how cold they were after she made a comment about having cold hands.  She wants to know if this is flirtatious, if she is overthinking this, or if maybe he views her as more of a little sister. We both have different opinions on this, and she helped me write this... But we are both curious of outsiders opinions, thank you!  ​  TLDR; Older boss in a committed relationship hanging out with me often, and complimenting my appearance, curious about other peoples thoughts.

title: My boyfriend doesn’t want to workout?
self_text: i absolutely love my boyfriend and he means the world to me, i will love him and his body no matter what. the problem is he’s not happy with his body, he gained a couple pounds since we’ve been together and it’s really started to bother him. i myself am super into working out, i love it. i‘ve tried to get him to come with me on multiple occasions but it’s always “i’m too self conscious” “i’m tired from work” “my stomach hurts” “i’ll go tomorrow”. he’ll complain and complain about his body but does absolutely nothing to change it. when he says he’s going to the gym something always comes up, like today it was that he was too tired and he felt sick. again, i love him, but i can’t stand him talking himself down when he is perfectly capable of hitting the gym a couple times a week and he knows this. he pays for my membership and his but hasn’t used his in over a year. should i stop trying to push him to workout and just listen to him complain?

title: AITA for not liking a coworker?
self_text: I've(22M) have been working at a office for the past year. you see, everything was fine there was little to no drama and i've made good friends there. Recently we have had a new employee (Zack 18-20M) In the beginning Zack seemed like a nice person and I was amazed by him, I became his friend, something however was off about him after a while whenever I came into work I always see Zack being the center of attention by saying stupid stuff, controlling what others do and getting his way. everyone seemed to love him because he always said what they wanted to hear and he always was nice to them. at first it didn't bother me the dude is just being himself I can respect that, I even found out we shared the same birthday and treated him like a brother.  after a while I often heard Zack badmouth people behind their backs simply because other co-workers didn't like them. at one point it felt like I was going insane because of Zack, wondering if i'm overreacting about the guy or just going crazy, my therapist told me to avoid Zack as he is a Narcissist.  So yeah I avoided the guy I didn't want any trouble I always go into work with the motive of just getting through the day. Eventually zack found out and wanted to talk (Only people that knew I didn't like him were my friends) me and Zack talked for a bit and we came to an understanding I forgave him and treated my mistrust of him as just a misunderstanding.  We became buds again and everything was fine, not until he had the office in uproar over what he thought was a minor mistake I made and could have fixed instantly, I tried to explain myself but he wasn't listening, My boss had to intervene and told me to leave the office and go home for the day he told Zack to apologise to me but Zack said since I hated him he will never apologise, and now the entire office knew I didn't like him.  Now we are back where we started I avoid Zack and try not to talk to him unless my work needs me to. Zack was offended. my co-workers who were nosy then came to me asking me why I don't hang with them anymore, I confessed that my therapist told me to avoid all encounters with Zack. Zack overhead me and started bitching about it cursing me and telling me a bunch of nonsense, our boss just stood there and watch him yell at me.  few months later I forgave Zack again and I told him I did, the first thing he does after that is try to get under my skin by showing me a picture from a manga panel of a character saying they hate another. I tried to explain to Zack that no its not us because we are cool now, HR intervenes and tell me to go home to avoid another argument.  Now my friends want me to forgive Zack because they somehow forget all the terrible things he does, my friends then did a 180 on me accusing me of being Jealous of him and somehow i'm the asshole when I wanted to just avoid the guy.

title: I'm not a good brother or son or friend and I genuinely don't care
self_text: My (19) brother (20) had bullied me and hit me, my dad (43) is a pervert and nobody else has seemed to notice but me, my dad has slapped me so hard that I bled from my lip even I was around 10, my friends have been toxic and blamed me for my breakup even though they couldn't stay out of it, and it seems when I finally speak up about it that I'M the problem.   I was with my brother the other day driving in house car to pick up our Xbox and he started having a conversation with me. Asking about if I'm looking for a relationship, if I want one, if there was anybody I liked. And I kept giving him short answers. I said I do eventually but I'm not looking for anyone right now.   I especially just hate him because he's in a good healthy relationship and I'm jealous because he wouldn't have been a better brother to me without her. And they're both home making sure everyone knows they're happy.  I hate seeing my childhood bully get to be happy after everything he's done to me and said to me with almost no feeling bad because it's in the past but I still remember everything and feel it every day. I doubt he would of even cared that I had cut myself if he didn't have his girlfriend.  My dad decided to look at my scars and loudly ask "Oh have you been cutting again?" With a joking tone. And he's seen them before and never decided to ask before so why on Thanksgiving?   When he first found out he decided to make it all about himself.  When he found out I was suicidal he said "If you feel like hitting something hit me"   Every single time they get on my nerves and can visibly tell they decide to get all defensive and get mad at me for having any other emotions other than be happy that they're jerks to me and always have been.  I have good talks about my life with my youth pastor but his son (18) body shamed my (ex) girlfriend (19) and is one of the main reasons we broke up. And he refuses to take responsibility. He only hated her because he was single even though he's made out with 5 or 6 girls within one school year. He thinks he's better than everyone else now just because he has a good Christian girlfriend, and so now he doesn't need to take part in the arguments about how he ruined the only good thing I had going for me.  I want to hurt them all how they hurt me and I know I can but what if everyone turns against me again?  I feel trapped and I know the only escape is suicide.

title: My father is trying to make me quit my drama class because he says it makes me a sissy but I refuse to quit.
self_text: Hi my name is Cody I’m 15 years old. I’ve always liked drama ever since I was little and when I started my freshman year of high school I enrolled in the drama program at my high school. I really like the teacher her name is Alena she’s in her mid twenties and she’s so nice. I had been keeping the fact that that I’m in the theater program as a secret between my mother and I because I know how my father is. Well Thursday my father found out when he saw me talking to my drama teacher. When I got in the car he called me a sissy and said that he wanted me to quit. I told him that I wasn’t going to quit because it’s something that I enjoy and want to pursue. We argued all the way home and when we got home I told my mother what he said. She went off on him and he’s since been forced to sleep on the couch. He’s currently refusing to speak to me. I don’t feel like I should quit something I love because of him and my mother agrees. What do you guys think.
